long_desc.thetext: The excellent ElementTree module that we re-distribute seems to be part of the vanilla Python distribution since 2.5 (as xml.etree.ElementTree I believe). We might consider switching to the standard module.
Confirm xml.etree.ElementTree is in since Python 2.5.

It turns out that the xml.etree.ElementTree library of stand. Python 2.5 is rather old, reflecting version 1.2.6 of ElementTree. But at the author's site there is a newer version, with much improved support for XPath expressions. I think this version is more interesting, and would merrit a continued support of our tool/pylib/elementtree distribution.
I've commited version 1.3a3 of ElementTree for testing, so we can see if we can safely use this new version.
With r24817.

I'm closing this. The custom ElementTree 1.3a3 module installation has proven itself, and we're already using its advanced features (like [@attr='value'] node predicates). The 1.3 API of ElementTree is only available with Python 2.7. And as it is rather unlikely that we require Python >=2.7 as a prerequisite, this will only be interesting again if we migrate to Python 3.x.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
